about_the_game:
Galactic Super Station is a Colony Sim and City Builder game where players are tasked with building and running their very own Space Station.

In the distant future, Humans have ventured far into the Milky Way Galaxy and found themselves among Silvians, a race of silicon based humanoids, and Androids, a race of humanoid robots, within an anarcho-capitalist society.

The game lets you play in a variety of open-ended ways. Players can assume the role of a space warlord, engage in the intergalactic narcotics trade, and even commit war crimes. Alternatively, they can run a stellar haven, catering to Humans, Silvians, and Androids alike.


Players can build different machines and objects to expand their space station using a grid-based building system. Additionally, the game allows players to expand vertically to upto ten Z-levels.

The game simulates a variety of systems:
  • Air System: Maintain optimal Air Pressure and Gas Composition conditions within the space station.
  • Power Grid System: Construct Power Generators, Batteries and Capacitors to ensure optimal power levels on the space station’s power grid.
  • Temperature System: Control the space station’s Thermal conditions to suit the different races in the game.
  • Sanitation System: Help Humans and Silvians manage their Hygiene levels and Androids keep their Corruption levels in check.
  • …and many more immersive systems.
Players will be able to customize their space station to their hearts’ desire. Every machine and object in the game serves a specific purpose and they must be repaired and maintained.


All three races - Humans, Silvians and Androids - have different optimal environmental condition requirements that must be balanced (or skewed towards one race). For example, Humans prefer low air pressure (15 psi), medium temperature (20°C), and breathe in Oxygen while expelling Carbon Dioxide while Silvians prefer high pressure (45 psi), high temperature (30°C), and breathe in Nitrogen while expelling Ammonia.

Units from different factions will visit the space station and some of them really don’t get along with others. Players can choose to favor certain factions over others but beware because some factions don’t take kindly to being offended.

All units in the game - crew or guest - have distinct personalities that dictate their behavior. They form relationships with other units, remembering friends and foes for a long time. Units will also have preferences for certain foods and drinks over others, refusing to eat or drink specific items. Every unit in the game feels like an unique individual.

Smooth operation of the space station requires the procurement of various resources - Oxygen and Nitrogen Gas for the air system, Organic and Silic Food for nutrition, and Water and Hydrazine for hydration. Players can choose to mine asteroids and grow the food themselves, or just buy them from the various factions that visit the space station.


Space can be a harsh place, and players will have to defend their space station against various threats.

Hazards are occasional events that can wreak havoc on the space station. Solar Flares can overload the power grid and set the space station ablaze. Comets can damage hull integrity and even lead to breaches. Hostile space-dwelling aliens can infiltrate the space station and cause mayhem and destruction.

On the other hand, sometimes the biggest threats are people. Space Pirates will frequently raid upstanding and prosperous space stations, while Space Police will raid the more nefarious ones.

Players will be able to defend their space station with armed guards and spacecrafts, leading to epic gunfights and dogfights, respectively.


Players can participate in various inter-galactic economies to cater to different factions for both profit and renown.

The game features a host of different economies:
  • Mining: Mine Asteroids and turn them into valuable Resources like gases, liquids and metals.
  • Agriculture: Grow both Organic and Silic crops to produce foods for Humans and Silvians, respectively.
  • Manufacturing: Produce and sell Resources such as metal plates and space fuel, Equipment such as weapons and space suits, and even bespoke Spacecrafts.
  • Hospitality: Cater to different races and factions as they enjoy their stay at your space station by providing them with foods, drinks, beds and android charging stations.
  • Forex: Collect and exchange different currency reserves in an ever-fluctuating galactic economy.
  • …and many more dynamic economies.
Players will be able to relocate their space station to various orbits within the Solar Map. Each orbit will have different challenges and factions to deal with, depending on the planets and space colonies that have been procedurally generated. This ensures a unique experience with every playthrough.

Expand your space station from a small mining outpost to a bustling hub of interstellar commerce as you lead your crew through hazards, unruly visitors, and peaceful times. Build YOUR vision of a monumental space station - the Galactic Super Station.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: 4 Cores / 2.5 GHz+
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Iris Xe / AMD Radeon 660M / Nvidia GeForce MX330
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: 6 Cores / 3.0 GHz+
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Iris Xe / AMD Radeon 660M / Nvidia GeForce MX330
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: Galactic Super Station is a City Builder and Colony Sim game about building and running your very own space station. Cater to civilians and outlaws alike, defend your station from hostile aliens and factions, and establish a radiant beacon in the vastness of the cosmos.
supported_languages:
English*, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Portuguese - Brazil, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese
*languages with full audio support
